Nonbreeding adult.description: Black Rosy-Finches are darker overall, almost black, whereas Brown-capped Rosy-Finches are browner overall. They also have an obvious gray crown that Brown-capped lack.

Juvenile.description: Juvenile Black Rosy Finches tend to be darker brown with buffy wingbars, whereas juvenile Brown-capped Rosy-Finches are paler and don't have well-defined wingbars.

Adult (Gray-crowned).description: Gray-crowned Rosy-Finches have a more obvious gray crown than Brown-capped Rosy-Finches, which have a dark grayish brown crown.

Adult (Hepburn's).description: Gray-crowned Rosy-Finches on the coast have a gray crown and gray cheeks unlike Brown-capped Rosy-Finches, which have a grayish brown crown and brown cheeks.

Juvenile.description: Juvenile Gray-crowned Rosy-Finches are brown overall like juvenile Brown-capped Rosy-Finches and are difficult to separate, but their breeding ranges do not overlap.
